[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 54]
Reasoning: I need to analyze the current state and choose from the Standard Pack options. Let me look at what's available:

1. Jack of Spades (Lucky Card) - +10 chips, 1 in 5 chance for +20 Mult, 1 in 15 chance to win $20. Also creates a Planet card for final played poker hand if held in hand.

2. 8 of Hearts (Mult enhancement) - +8 chips, +4 Mult

3. 4 of Diamonds - +4 chips. Creates the Planet card for final played poker hand if held in hand.

Current strategy:
- My main strategy is Three of a Kind
- I have Wily Joker that gives +100 Chips for Three of a Kind
- I have Half Joker that gives +20 Mult if played hand contains 3 or fewer cards
- I have Smiley Face that gives +5 Mult per face card scored
- I have Constellation at X1.3 Mult that scales with Planet cards

Let me evaluate each option:

**Jack of Spades (Lucky Card)**:
- It's a face card, so it synergizes with Smiley Face (+5 Mult when scored)
- Lucky enhancement gives chances for bonus mult and money
- Creates Planet cards when held - this synergizes AMAZINGLY with Constellation!
- This is extremely valuable because:
  1. Face card = Smiley Face synergy
  2. Planet card generation = Constellation scaling
  3. Lucky bonus is gravy on top

**8 of Hearts (Mult enhancement)**:
- Enhanced with Mult, so it gives +8 chips and +4 Mult when scored
- This is good for raw scoring power
- I already have an 8 in my deck (8 of Hearts and 8 of Diamonds were in my previous hand)
- This could help me make Three of a Kind with 8s more consistently


- The 4 of Diamonds also generates Planet cards but lacks the face card synergy and has minimal chip value. While the Planet generation helps Constellation, the Jack's combination of face card bonus, stronger base stats, and lucky enhancement makes it significantly more powerful.

The Jack of Spades is the clear winner here—it hits multiple synergies at once while the 8 of Hearts offers only direct scoring and the 4 is too weak to compete.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
